result.execSummary:
The defendant Eratus S Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eratus S Green

records.addlTxt: Prisoner Release Form
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Eratus S Green in court, in custody.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Eratus S Green.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Sam Berg. Called @ 1:23 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing. Record by Atty. Hagerman as to agreement. Court goes over maximum penalties and deportation warnings with the defendant. Defendant responds to Court's questions as to plea questionnaire. Atty. Hagerman responds to Court's questions regarding entry of plea and stipulation to facts in complaint. 
Defendant pleads GUILTY to Count #2.  Counts #1 and #3 are dismissed and read-in. 
Court finds plea to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent, and finds defendant guilty. 
Defendant does not make a statement.
Court adopts agreement of the parties:

$500.00 fine plus costs
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant released from jail on this matter. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Eratus S Green appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Eratus S Green.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford. Called @ 1:24 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on Motion to Modify bond. Atty. Hagerman responds to Court's questions regarding change in circumstances. Response by the Court as to risk assessment which lists defendant as high risk. State objection to modification of bond.
Based upon the record and risk assessment, court denies motion to modify bond.
Future court dates remain on as scheduled.
Authorization to Appear and Act
BTC: "I'll hear it on 10/5" DJ 9/23/2022
By Defendant

Defendant Eratus S Green in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Eratus S Green.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Hagerman. State objects to bond motion. Denied, bond remains. Speedy trial demanded by defendant. Trial dates set. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Eratus S Green appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Eratus S Green.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered by counsel. Speedy trial rights reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Bond motion hearing requested.  Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
